results.content:
I though this course has given me an excellent introduction to modern Wordpress development using the new JS tools like Node and Gulp.

I had always heard about them but never got around to learning them.

I think learning them with wordpress is a great way to teach it, because I can incorporate it into my "Real World" work

results.content: Nice course, well explained and interesting, but unfortunately incomplete. Some arguments (like GIT) are introduced without any explations on practical use. Others are anticipated but never explained (gulp browser sync).
results.content_html: Nice course, well explained and interesting, but unfortunately incomplete. Some arguments (like GIT) are introduced without any explations on practical use. Others are anticipated but never explained (gulp browser sync).

results.content: great course. instructor is full with practical knowledge, which he passes to the students. this course helped me very much to upgrade my skills
results.content_html: great course. instructor is full with practical knowledge, which he passes to the students. this course helped me very much to upgrade my skills

results.content:
I am willing to give this class a 3.5. I cannot give it a 4 because it is an unfinished project. Showing me how to set up a workflow is not a workflow. Showing me how you complete an entire project from git init to deployment is teaching me a useful and effective workflow. However, there is a still a nice amount of information and data I was able to glean from this. 



This is a class for customers/students that are not confident enough in their present knowledge-base to set up a Wordpress development environment using tools like Git, NodeJS, and Gulp. In that regard, I would suggest Googling more, because this class might confuse more than aid. While it is what I would consider "Beginner's level" for tooling/workflow, it is not thorough enough to aid a professional or dedicated hobbyist. Furthermore, purely from a business to customer standpoint, Bruce makes promises he does not keep. 

In this course, Bruce promises to teach students/paying Udemy customers how to minimize/compress on upload Wordpress thumbnails, but does not. In this course, Bruce promises to teach students/paying Udemy customers how to utilize LiveReload, which for some strange reason he decides not to included, while showing a browser implementing some form of automatic reload. 

Without delving into teaching style(it felt more like being sold a car as opposed to being guided from one layer of knowledge to another), an obviously limited understanding of PHP(how he handles sprintf() tickled me), or as another student/paying customer of Udemy mentioned, how needlessly repetitive it was, this is simply bad business. 

As programmers, and budding programmers, it is typically in bad taste to sell people something in beta without telling them it is in beta.  Buyer beware.
results.content_html:

In that regard, I would suggest Googling more, because this class might confuse more than aid. Without delving into teaching style(it felt more like being sold a car as opposed to being guided from one layer of knowledge to another), an obviously limited understanding of PHP(how he handles sprintf() tickled me), or as another student/paying customer of Udemy mentioned, how needlessly repetitive it was, this is simply bad business.

As programmers, and budding programmers, it is typically in bad taste to sell people something in beta without telling them it is in beta. Buyer beware.

results.content: Really good intro to getting all these technologies set up. Gives you the base for each so you can get up and running as soon as possible.

Got exactly what I was looking for which was using Gulp, Composer and  Sass in Wordpress development.

results.content: I think these concepts and technologies are nice. I just had already gotten a more advanced, simpler, more intuitive workflow before taking this course. For a WordPress developer without a workflow yet this course would help them very much. Besides, Bruce is a really good teacher, making concepts really sink in.

For a WordPress developer without a workflow yet this course would help them very much. Besides, Bruce is a really good teacher, making concepts really sink in.

results.content: Allthougt this course could help people to improve the development workflow, I think there is some information missing, There is no browser sync explanation, and also the error handling to avoid gulp to stop after an error is made.

results.content: Too many repetitions. Too many minutes to explain the same thing. Too long. Half of the time would be ample for all the subjects covered. No reactions to requests. Some errors, no fixes and no feedback.

results.content:
There are a lot of stuff missing in this course, it is not half finished. And it is after all 4 years old. You do not need to have ANY knowledge of PHP, as PHP is not mentioned in this course. It's certainly an advantage to know the WordPress directory structure, but in no way a needed skill to finish this course. Browser syncronization is mentioned but never shown. 

I may be a lot more than "intermediate", but I feel that any person with an avarage IQ and willingness to learn, could complete this course without any previous knowledge of programming... 

That is good, but I actually thought this would be a course for me, with 40 years programming experience, the last 10 as a WP developer. So, I feel that the description is way off, it is one of the cheapest courses around, so I did not loose a lot of money, but whatever I paid, it is not worth it, honestly.

results.content:
Purtroppo, come molti altri corsi (almeno fino a questo punto), l'insegnante impiega tantissimo tempo a ricapitolare ciò che è stato fatto durante la lezione precedente - cosa che trovo assurda (a meno che non si voglia "allungare il brodo" volutamente per estendere la durata delle lezioni). Si perde il senso di avere dei corsi suddivisi in lezioni on-demand, che è proprio il fulcro di piattaforme come Udemy - soprattutto quando si tratta di corsi di livello intermedio-avanzato in cui l'utente medio di norma è abbastanza capace e non ha molto tempo da perdere.

Altra cosa (ma non so se dipenda da come sono state girate le lezioni o se dipenda da Udemy), la parte video è sempre in ritardo, non segue la parte audio, quindi mi ritrovo sempre disallineato da quello che vedo rispetto a ciò che ascolto.

Per il momento, tutto quanto è molto snervante.

Altra cosa (ma non so se dipenda da come sono state girate le lezioni o se dipenda da Udemy), la parte video è sempre in ritardo, non segue la parte audio, quindi mi ritrovo sempre disallineato da quello che vedo rispetto a ciò che ascolto.

Per il momento, tutto quanto è molto snervante.

results.content:
Sorry, but using your course with current versions of wordpress and vertrigo didn't work even for me. I am a professional that works with development for more than 5 years, so I was wondering how messy this would be for new developers with no experience. You shouldn't change wordpress directory.


On the other hand, the tips for working with Gulp and Node JS makes this course worth it.
results.content_html:
Sorry, but using your course with current versions of wordpress and vertrigo didn't work even for me. I am a professional that works with development for more than 5 years, so I was wondering how messy this would be for new developers with no experience. You shouldn't change wordpress directory.

On the other hand, the tips for working with Gulp and Node JS makes this course worth it.

results.content: Surface level explainations, everything you would find within your first 25 minute search into the topic yourself. Great stuff to know, this man takes the longest route on earth to get things out there, though. Needs to spend a little more time editing the clips to shorten things up and consider UX more. Like, its a video we have the power to rewind, theres no need for us to see you mistype things or take 5 seconds to hit the refresh button (off a dropdown menu...) or change the background 10 times.
results.content_html: Surface level explainations, everything you would find within your first 25 minute search into the topic yourself. Great stuff to know, this man takes the longest route on earth to get things out there, though. Needs to spend a little more time editing the clips to shorten things up and consider UX more. Like, its a video we have the power to rewind, theres no need for us to see you mistype things or take 5 seconds to hit the refresh button (off a dropdown menu...) or change the background 10 times.

results.content:
I was looking forward to giving this course a try, but I'm really disappointed. So after a bit into section 2, I have to give up. It sometimes feels like the instructor gets paid per word because he is sometimes so wordy, overly repetitive and makes a big deal out of nothing. This course is supposed to be at an intermediate level, but somehow we need an entire video about copying and pasting a folder (!).

Well. I might return to this course if I have some specific issues down the road, but otherwise, it was a waste. Too bad I started it quite long after buying it so that I can't get a refund...
results.content_html:
